W: It’s very irritating. That’s probably the busiest line at that time of the morning. I don’t know why they decided to do that. 
M: Q2 I think if we get a few other people together, I can drive my car into work. Traffic will be bad but it’s much better than taking the bus.

Script
W-Br: Hi, Mr. Pork. Thanks for meeting with me.
M-Au: Sure. It’s a pleasure. So, 65 you’re writing an article for Forge Ahead Magazine?
W-Br: Yes, 65 the piece is about how your car manufacturing plant dramatically changed the way it produces cars. Could you tell me about what you did?
M-Au: Certainly. Many factory employees are told to never stop production line – no matter what. 66 Recently I took the opposite approach. Whenever we found a defect, anyone could stop the assembly line and address the problem immediately.
W-Br: 66 And this transition improved your quality control?
M-Au: Exactly. In fact, look at this production chart. You’ll see that, 67 compared to the other factories, cars from this one have far fewer defects.

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Hello, everyone. I would like to begin today’s seminar by asking you all to consider a few questions. First, how many of you would like to be rich? Everyone? Exactly. Second, how many of you would like to be happy? Everyone? Of course! Q2 I can promise you all that if you follow a few simple steps, you will be able to make your financial and life goals a reality. The Fast Forward Financial System, or FFFS, that I have developed is an easy step-by-step guide to living the good life. Q3 Today’s seminar is just an introduction of course. In order to fulfill your financial potential, you will need to enroll in one of our immersion programs.

answer.explanation: Welcome to Big Toys’ warehouse orientation. As the industry leader in children’s toys, it is essential that you understand the huge volume of merchandise that you will be dealing with as a stockroom worker. The worksheet in front of you is a map of our warehouse. Each section of the warehouse is divided into zones by the type of toy, and then arranged alphabetically by manufacturer. At the bottom of the map is a list of toys we would like you to collect and place on the designated pallet for shelving. There will be a “Z” and a number before the name of the toy, to let you know what zone it is in. This is a timed exercise, and all toys should be collected within 1 hour. I understand this is a trial by fire, but once you get the hang of our organization, you will be able to complete a task like this with ease.

(B) Big Toys has a large selection of products.

answer.text: (B) Big Toys has a large selection of products.

answer.explanation: Hello everyone, I wanted to get you together to go over the recent failures in our customer service department here at Monster Telecom. In order to prepare you all to handle the most frequently asked questions from our customers, I have distributed the graph in front of you. Please go over this graph with your team leader and develop a plan to improve our customer service. Next quarter’s reviews will be in two months. We aim to have half as many weekly calls by then.

Hi, everyone, let’s start the weekly work meeting. Q1 Firstly, I want you to know that I’ve hired five more staff for the main factory room. Q2 I know that you are all overworked; I'm trying hard to push for funding to get two more people in over the next few months. The new staff will be here on Monday morning, so I want everyone to go out of their way to train them as quickly as possible. To do this efficiently, I’m going to have each of you train the new staff in a particular section of the factory. Q3 Please prepare some instructions and email them to me so I can double-check them.

answer.explanation: Welcome to the new employee orientation at Tockney Nature Center. We’re happy that you'll be guiding our bird-watching tours! Behind me there’s a trail map of the Nature Center. We'll be walking down trail two so I can show you some interesting spots to take visitors. You can use the other trails as well, except for this trail right here because there’s family of bald eagles nesting nearby. For the first time, the Center collaborating with the state university on a research project about eagles. We’re positioned a live camera on one tree there, and we don’t want anything to disturb the birds for the duration of the study.

question.text: Aurora Furnishings is finding it difficult to make a profit in its _____competitive market.

answer.explanation:
The blank precedes a noun phrase with adj + noun, so an adverb is suitable to modify the adjective
=> Choose C

question.text: At Correia Electronics, we are  ______ researching appliance technology.

answer.explanation: Use an adverb that modifies verb "research"

question.text: The lecturer  _____ on the country’s struggle for independence when he gives his talk.

answer.explanation:
S + will V + when + S + V / Vs / Ves
=> Choose C

question.text: The cost of the final product nearly doubled ------- a rise in the price of the raw materials used to make it.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before a noun phrase => eliminate C and D.
In the other two options, "but" is usually preceded by nouns in the "nothing but" "," All but ", so it can't be used here.
So the answer chosen is B.

question.text: The Oakwood Restaurant  …………………..a special dinner menu on Saturdays for the past decade.

answer.explanation: For the past decade=> Present perfect

question.text: She delayed___the contract until she had a chance to speak with her attorney.

answer.explanation: (B) The verb “delay” is followed by a gerund. Choice (A) is base form or simple present tense. Choice (C) is an infinitive. Choice (D) is a noun.

question.text: Mr. Hotel had to undergo several medical tests before receiving _____  diagnosis from the physician.

answer.explanation:
A is not the correct answer because he is the subject, leading the sentence
B is not the correct answer because after the blank there is a noun
C is not the correct answer because “himself” is only at the end of the sentence or right after the subject
=>Choose D (his)

question.text: The director attributed the success of the film  _____  to the experience and talent of the actor in the lead role.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose C

question.text: The Hokodo Orchestra will hold ………………….for new string musicians next Tuesday.

answer.explanation:
Choose the correct answer based on the meaning of the sentence.
=> D

question.text: The new chairs that he bought for the office___not very comfortable.

answer.explanation: (B) The plural verb form “are” agrees with the plural subject “chairs”. Choices (A) and (D) are singular forms. Choice (C) doesn’t make sense in this sentence.

question.text: If you have questions about your most …………..credit card statement, call Mr. Hassan.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer.
=> D

question.text: The guard must ___ your identification at the gate.

answer.explanation: (D) Must requires the simple form of the verb. Choice (A) is the past tense. Choice (B) is the progressive form. Choice (C) is the third-person singular form.

question.text: An extensive  _____  conducted by Ivanex Communications revealed that Internet speed was one of the most important factors to customers.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose D

question.text: The Globe Lighting Supply handbook ___ a list of important company telephone numbers.

answer.explanation: The answer comes before a noun so it is in its active voice. The subject "handbook" is singular so we choose "contains".

question.text: The analyst's commentary in the progress report was sharply ___ of the leadership team.

answer.explanation: Be critical of = Disapprove of

question.text: Mrs. Johnson handled the dispute ___, by holding private discussions in her office.

answer.explanation: Discreetly = Carefully and secretly

question.text: A midsize design -------, Gilwood Interiors specializes in residential spaces.

answer.explanation: This is a vocabulary question, so it should be based on meaning to give an accurate answer.

question.text: Tin Creek Corporation_____that its paper towels are the most absorbent on the market.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer.

question.text: There is not much agriculture in this area because the___yearly rainfall is so low.

answer.explanation: (D) “Average” means “typical amount”. Choices (A), (B), and (C) look similar to the correct answer but do not fit the context of the sentence.

question.text: Norvo Financial has built an…………………..Client base in a short period of time.

answer.explanation: In the middle of the article and a noun word, we need an adjective

question.text: Employees must receive ___ approval for any travel that will be reimbursed by the company.

answer.explanation: Prior = Previous = Earlier

question.text: Mobile phones have become___ prevalent that telecommunications companies are establishing service in areas previously thought too remote.

answer.explanation: So + adj + that

question.text: All employees should back up crucial data ……………………..switching over to the new software System on August 5.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: The vacant rooms on the inn’s second floor have _____ been cleaned.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose D

question.text: The ship provisions officer ___ his supplies in large quantities.

answer.explanation: (B) The present tense indicates habit, which is logical here; this also requires an -s ending for the third person (store owner). Choice (A) is present but not third person. Choice (C) is the progressive. Choice (D) is the infinitive.

question.text: To make the tour accessible to Spanish speakers, the language  _____  plans to provide translation services.

answer.explanation:
The blank needs a subject => use a noun
=> Choose D

question.text: The information you provide on this questionnaire is strictly ___ and will not be shared with any other vendors.

answer.explanation: Confidential = Secret

question.text: During the holiday season, Schwartz Department store will  _____  special make-up gift sets.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose B

question.text: The new location of the Bentler Company is easily  _____  by car or bus.

answer.explanation: Need adjectives because Be + adjectives

question.text: Prior to a viewing by potential buyers, the real estate agent makes sure the home is  _____.

answer.explanation:
The blank comes after tobe => need an adjective
=> Choose C

question.text:
Hurst Airlines Improves its Customer Service Offerings
LOS ANGELES (September 22) - Hurst Airlines has started installing self-check-in kiosks where passengers can scan their identification, print their own boarding passes, and tag their own luggage to be loaded onto the aircraft. These new -1.-- are already in place at two airports in California.— 2.-— will soon be available at all airports where Hurst Airlines flies. According to Hurst Airlines CEO Roxana Ghazi, the company aims for all its service areas —3.— equipped with kiosks by the end of the summer.
The intent of these kiosks is to make the check-in process run more quickly. Said Ms. Ghazi, "We have limited staff, and lines can often be quite long.— 4.—. These new kiosks are expected to significantly reduce the amount of time spent in line."

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer

Use the previous sentence to judge what the subject being repeated
- Devices (in the previous sentence) - plural noun
- The answer is they

To be equipped with ...
=> use passive voice

choices: (B)Passengers should arrive two hours before a flight.
(C)We expect to hire more staff soon.
(D)This is especially true during peak operating times.

answer.text: (D)This is especially true during peak operating times.
answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of the sentence to choose the correct answer.

question.text:
Protection & Conservation
The Garner Museum of Art (GMA) ensures the preservation of its collection by carefully —-1 — the lighting of its galleries. Certain artifacts-many of which are thousands of years old-are particularly sensitive to light. —2— , the museum does not showcase any of its pieces in areas with windows. Nor does it keep artwork in areas with certain kinds of —3— , potentially harmful bulbs. —-4—. By taking such measures, the GMA hopes that its collection will be enjoyed for generations to come.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

The word to be filled in comes after "kinds of" and before "bulbs" -> a noun phrase should be entered. While "harmful" is an adjective to add the meaning to "bulbs," we also need to fill in an adjective in the blank.

choices: (A)Therefore, the museum will place some of its older pieces on loan.
(C)Only a few staff members possess these specialized skills.
(D)Unfortunately, it can be difficult to determine an object's age.

answer.explanation: Based on the previous and the following sentences to choose the correct answer.

question.text:
January 28
Ojas Ramachandran
Sawat Clothing Company
Bengaluru 560 001
Karnataka, India

Dear Mr. Ramachandran:
We are writing to let you know about a temporary (1) ______ in our order fulfillment service. On March 20, we will begin moving all of our inventory to a new warehouse in Kyoto. (2) ______ . The move will take up to two weeks, (3) ______ which time we will be unable to ship overseas orders. (4) ______ any delays, please place your next order by March 14. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact me.

Sincerely,
Aiko Oba
Customer Service Director
We are writing to let you know about a temporary (1) ______ in our order fulfillment service.

answer.explanation:
Reading the following sentence we see that they will move the inventory to another location -> service will be
interrupted, in the sense that only answer D (interruption) is appropriate.

question.text: On March 20, we will begin moving all of our inventory to a new warehouse in Kyoto. (2) ______ .
choices: (A) This will allow us to keep a larger variety of items in stock.
(B) These will be available at a special price for a limited time.
(C) Warehousing has become an important industry in the region.
(D) You can track the status of your order on our Web site.

answer.text: (A) This will allow us to keep a larger variety of items in stock.
answer.explanation:
This question needs logic with both the previous one: the decision to move to Kyoto, and the following: the
transfer will take 2 weeks -> answer A. This allows us to keep a
larger stockpile is suitable.

question.text: The move will take up to two weeks, (3) ______ which time we will be unable to ship overseas orders.

answer.explanation:
Only answer C is appropriate, which means during that time (2 weeks),
we will not be able to ship the item to foreign countries.

question.text: (4) ______ any delays, please place your next order by March 14. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact me.

answer.explanation:
For purpose, we can only use to-V, that is to avoid delays, please order in
advance 14/10.

question.text: This manual provides guidelines for inventory control at Malanta facilities. Our advanced manufacturing procedures depend on ---1---- inventory control. Only by maintaining a precise flow of inventory ---2--- minimize costs and ensure prompt shipments. To achieve this goal, we must avoid shortages. When stock is in the correct location at the time it is ordered, shipments are made at regular shipping costs and within estimated time frames ---3---. Therefore, the procedures in this manual must always be faithfully ---4----.

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer
Choose (D) because the beginning of a sentence has word only then the clausemust be inversion

choices: (A) We have calculated the costs for you.
(B) Please allow at least two weeks for delivery.
(C) Unfortunately, some items are currently not in stock.
(D) However, this is not possible when unexpected shortages occur.

answer.text: (D) However, this is not possible when unexpected shortages occur.
answer.explanation: Select (D) mentioned by the previous 2 sentences shortages and goods in the right place at the right time brings benefits
Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text:
To: Pat Blackburn (pblackburn@fastweb.com)
From: Go Natural Health Products (cs@gonatural.com)
Date: February 4, 3:34 P.M.
Subject: Product Order

We appreciate that you have chosen Go Natural Health Products for your vitamin and mineral supplements. All of our products are carefully inspected for quality and meet all government regulations. Additionally, during the month of February, customers making purchases over $100.00 do not have to pay any shipping fees.

Shipping address: Pat Blackburn, 2709 Michigan Ave., Clinton WI
Details: 6 bottles of Green Source multivitamin pills.
Total: $180.00, paid with credit card (XXXX xxxx xxxx 8766)

All our products come with a 100% customer satisfaction guarantee. If you are dissatisfied, please call our customer service center at 987-555-3427 for a full refund within a week of the order.

Go Natural Health Products

question.text: What is indicated about Ms. Blackburn’s order?

question.text:
MEMO

From: Eun Mi Ha, CEO
To: All Employees Subject: January 10 Meeting
Date: January 13

As announced at the company meeting on January 10, we will be changing the regular work hours for most employees as part of our initiative to reduce energy costs. Since our energy costs are generally higher in the late afternoon, it will be to our advantage to perform more work in the morning. Therefore, beginning on Monday, February 24, the workday will officially start at 8:00 A.M. instead of 9:00 A.M., and it will end at 4:00 PM. instead of 5:00 PM. The last day of the old schedule will be Friday, February 21, and the office will close at 5:00 P.M. on that day.

Employees in the accounting department will not be affected by the change, since their schedule is determined by normal banking hours.
What are employees asked to do?
choices: (C) Take a shorter break in the afternoon
(D). Submit their time sheets to the accounting department

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "As announced at the company meeting on January 10, we will be changing the regular work hours for most employees as part of our initiative to reduce energy costs."

question.text: When will the change go into effect?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Therefore, beginning on Monday, February 24, the workday will officially start at 8:00 A.M. instead of 9:00 A.M., and it will end at 4:00 PM. instead of 5:00 PM. "

question.text:
April 3
Larry Martin
Kansas Neat & Tidy
5448 Lakeside Drive
Arlington, Kansas 67514

Dear Mr. Martin,

We are interested in using your company’s cleaning services for this year’s Halley Valley Rock Festival. The festival will begin on Friday, June 14, and last the entire weekend, ending on the night of Sunday, June 16. However, unlike previous years, this year we would like your company to clean the festival grounds intermittently throughout the festival. Therefore, we will be providing your company with a temporary office trailer where your workers can take breaks from the heat.

We look forward to working with your company again this year.
Sincerely,
Karen Johnson
Festival Coordinator, Halley Valley Foundation
According to the letter, what will be provided?

answer.explanation: “Therefore, we will be providing your company with a temporary office trailer where your workers can take breaks from the heat.”

question.text: Who most likely is Mr. Martin?

answer.explanation: This email was sent to a person from the cleaning company to discuss the cleaning of the festival grounds. So answer C is the most suitable.

Your number one source for sneakers

Once you become a premium member, you will enjoy the following benefits:
- Expedited shipping for $3 ($5 for a basic member)

- Returns on all items within 30 days of purchase at no extra charge (7 days for a basic member)

Upgrading your service from basic to premium takes just one click. To welcome customers to our new online store, this month we are offering the upgrade to annual premium membership at a discounted rate of just $50.

Information can be inferred from:
"We see that you are currently registered as a basic member at our website.

question.text:
Fulton Stainless steel Products

Fulton Stainless steel Products is a large-scale manufacturer making stainless steel industrial kitchen appliances in factories in Germany and France. The company’s products are trusted by chefs and bakers around the world to be durable, long-lasting, and of superb quality. The company produces kitchen stoves, ovens, microwaves, refrigerators, food processors, electric kettles, coffee makers, and other products.

After acquiring the Visor Home Products Company in a deal last month, the company expected its overall profits to increase 20% compared to the last fiscal year. As a result, to meet increased demand, the company will employ more than 300 full-time workers in our six factories and offer good pay with an excellent benefits package. The company considers all of its employees valuable members of the Fulton family. Additionally, the company continues to research and develop new products to satisfy its customers and compete with other companies.
Who is most likely to be a customer of Fulton Stainless steel Products?

answer.explanation: "Fulton Stainless steel Products is a large-scale manufacturer making stainless steel industrial kitchen appliances in factories in Germany and France." We can see they manufacture kitchen appliances which are used in restaurant.

question.text: What did Fulton Stainless steel Products do last month?

answer.explanation: It is mentioned in: "After acquiring the Visor Home Products Company in a deal last month"

question.text: What is mentioned about Fulton Stainless Steel Products?
choices: (A) It recently provided extra funding for research and development.
(B) It has released a budget proposal for next year.
(C) It offers a benefits package to its part- time employees.
(D)  It plans to hire additional employees to work in factories.

answer.text: (D)  It plans to hire additional employees to work in factories.
answer.explanation: It can be inferred from:"...the company will employ more than 300 full-time workers in our six factories and offer good pay with an excellent benefits package."

question.text:
*Email*


To: Staff@holmana.co.uk
From: Robin Ruiz, Facilities Manager
Date: 12 October
Subject: New Desks

Dear staff,

We will soon be replacing all employee desks with new hybrid ones that will allow you to work while either seated or standing. The new desks are due to arrive on 20 October. --- [1] ---. I have requested that the delivery occur early in the morning before office hours so it does not interrupt our work. --- [2] ---. To make the transition go faster, please move the contents of your current desk, including personal items, into a cardboard box on the 19th.
You can read more about the model we've ordered at wilsonofficefurniture.com/hybrid56. --- [3] ---. My research showed this one to be the most user-friendly option. The height of the desk can be changed by simply flipping a latch and pushing a button.
Many of you have been requesting hybrid desks for some time now, so I am glad we are able to make this happen. This is only one of the changes management plans to implement this year in our efforts to make Holmana a healthier and happier workplace. --- [4] ---.

Best regards,
Robin Ruiz
How can employees help prepare for a delivery?
choices: (C) By completing their work in the morning
(D) By moving furniture out of their offices

answer.explanation: The information is located there “To make the transition go faster, please move the contents of your current desk, including personal items, into a cardboard box on the 19th ”(To make the transition faster, please move the components of your current desk, including your personal applications, to a cardboard box on the 19th.) The tablets are asked to do is pack the items on their table into boxes.

question.text: Why has the desk been chosen?
choices: (A) It has a large storage area.
(D) It is the cheapest option available.

answer.explanation: The reason for choosing a table lies in “this one to be the most user-friendly option. The height of the desk can be changed by simply flipping a latch and pushing a button ”(this is the most user-friendly option. The height of the desk can be changed simply by gently jerking the latch and pushing the button ). As such, this table type is easy to adjust.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
"Any other ideas you have for us are welcome."

answer.explanation: There is a sentence in the sentence "other ideas" that shows that in the previous sentence it must mention other "ideas" of the employee. Thus, only position [4] satisfies this condition, because the previous statements refer to the employee's requirements that the management has met.

question.text:
Anish Kumar 11:15 A.M.
Thanks everyone for getting together online before our next meeting. I thought it would be helpful to see what’s been done and what still needs to be done for the festival. I believe Ella has some news to share.
Ella Costa 11:16 A.M.
That’s right. I finally got a permit from the city council to hold the festival in Greenhill Park!

Fantastic!

When I showed them that our plans included ways to limit trash and other potential crowd-related problems, they were convinced.

Any other news?

King Pizza has already agreed to park a pizza truck at the festival. I also have several calls out to other local eateries. I should have responses from some others by the time we meet on Friday.
Kenneth Baudin 11:22 A.M.
I’m still working on getting more acts to perform. Janine Dougherty has tentatively agreed to sing with a band for a few numbers.
Anish Kumar 11:23 A.M.
That would be great. She has a great voice and she’s a local favorite here.
What are the writers discussing?

answer.explanation:
Ella Costa 11:16 AM
That's right. I finally got the permit from the city council to hold the festival in Greenhill Park.

That's right. I finally got the permit from the city council to hold the festival in Greenhill Park.
That's great news. I was worried they weren't going to come around

question.text: What is Ms. Park expecting?

question.text:
Travel & Recreation

123 Gilmore street

Orange County, CA 48857


November 15
Mr. Peter Kang
3820 Rivervalley Heights
Seattle, WA 19387

We at Travel & Recreation thank you for your subscription to our magazine. As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members. - [1] - As a member, you will continue to receive monthly editions of our magazine and access to our new online e-magazine services. You can simply download a digital version of the print magazine to any mobile device at no extra cost. -[2] - Furthermore, you can access background information about our authors, journalists, and guest writers, as well as detailed information about the locations and places that are covered in the magazine. In addition, you can access the recipes to the most popular restaurants around the world and, most exciting of all, we will hold an exclusive competition for our VIP members with a chance to win a trip for two to Hawaii. -[3] - Our regular subcribers, as well as VIP members, will have a chance to win a dining experience at 5-star restaurant Bellisimo.

Again we thank you for your continued support and we hope you enjoy the many changes we have made to our services as we strive to entertain and educate our loyal subscribers. - [4] - Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter. Please check which subscription plan you wish to join. If you send in a $100 fee, you will receive the regular subscription plan. If you send in $200 fee, you will become a VIP member.

We appreciate your support and hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,
Victoria Adams
Why was a letter sent to Mr. Kang?
choices: (A) To remind him to send in his travel journals
(B) To explain about a new subscription plan
(C) To inquire about his travel plans
(D) To determine his qualifications for a position

answer.text: (B) To explain about a new subscription plan
answer.explanation: The information is in: "As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members.'

question.text: What did Ms. Adams send with the letter?

answer.explanation: Based on the information in: "Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter. ", we can see that Ms. Adam send an application form with the letter.

question.text: In the middle of the first paragraph of the letter, the term “at no extra cost” is closest in meaning to:

answer.explanation:
extra cost: added cost to normal cost
no extra cost means no more or no added cost, which has the same meaning with free.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Your subscription expires next month, but we invite you to consider joining our VIP membership.”

answer.explanation: In the second sentence of the letter, Ms. Adam mentioned about VIP members. And in the following sentence after [1], she also wrote: "As a member, you will continue to receive monthly editions of our magazine and access to our new online e-magazine services." which is related to subscription and membership.

question.text:
Lost and Found

Parkway City is bracing for another holiday season and urging its citizens and tourists to keep track of their belongings. - [1] - Every year, more than 2000 items show up at the city lost and found located at Parkway City Hall. “But we get even more lost items during the holiday season,” explained Jean King, the managing director of the lost and found. “From around November 25 to January 2, we get a 25% increase in the number of items that are brought to US.”
- [2] - Everything from keys, sunglasses, umbrellas, and jewelry to electronic devices, luggage, and shopping bags full of newly purchased items have been brought to the center over the years. “The strangest item we got was a suitcase full of period piece costumes,” says Jean. “The intern working for a film at the time was happy to get it back.”
- [3] - If the items are not claimed within 90 days, they are auctioned off at a public event to raise money for the community center - [4] –
What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A) To advertise an event for the holidays
(B) To warn citizens of increased crimes
(C) To inform people about lost and found items
(D) To give information about an auction

answer.text: (C) To inform people about lost and found items
answer.explanation: The main content appears at the beginning of the article: "Every year, more than 2000 items show up at the city lost and found located at Parkway City Hall ”

question.text: What is suggested about Jean King?

answer.explanation:
Keyword Jean King
"Jean King, the managing director of the lost and found"

question.text: What is suggested about the lost items?
choices: (A) They are not kept indefinitely at the center.
(B) They are usually claimed by their owners.

answer.text: (A) They are not kept indefinitely at the center.
answer.explanation: “If the items are not claimed within 90 days, they are auctioned off at a public event to raise money for the community center. ”

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“Many people do come to claim their missing items, but a vast majority is still left unclaimed.”

answer.explanation: In terms of logic to be seamless with the following sentence: “Many people do come to claim their missing items, but a vast majority is still left unclaimed.”

Please be informed that both Building 3 conference rooms will be unavailable throughout the day on Monday, March 12, as our division of Brenton Solutions will be hosting the Corporate Management team. These meetings are expected to begin promptly at 9:30 A.M. and to extend one full hour past the time that afternoon meetings usually end. Any team leads in need of conference space on this date should send me their request no later than Friday by replying directly to this e-mail. Space will be reserved on a first-come, first-served basis. Thanks!
Janet Marten, Corporate Secretary
============================

question.text:
Colonial Heights Nursing Home

Colonial Heights is proud to have served the elderly population of Houston, Texas, for over 30 years. Our nursing home is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities. Our five-story building allows each floor to offer Individualized levels of care for our residents. Our building houses a rehabilitation gym and we also provide psychological counseling services for residents.
We currently have openings for several positions. We are looking to hire a nursing home administrator who has at least three years of experience and a valid license. There is also an opening for an admissions coordinator. Those applying for the admissions coordinator job must have a bachelor’s degree and at least two years of related experience. We are also looking for hospice workers who can provide personal care to residents in a compassionate and caring manner. Previous experience is not necessary, so everyone interested is welcome to apply for this position.
You can see this job listing and submit an application online by visiting our website at www.chnh.com.

==============================

To: Tommy Jenkins tommyjenkins7@zeusnet.com
From: Greg Parker g_parker@chnh.com
Subject:Hiring Procedure
Date:September 14

Dear Mr. Jenkins,

Congratulations! You have made it through the first round of the application process for the position of admissions coordinator. We require that all applicants visit Colonial Heights Nursing Home in order to attend an in-person interview. I would appreciate it if you let me know about a convenient time for your interview by September 17.

I look forward to meeting you.

Sincerely,

Greg Parker
Human Resources Manager
Colonial Heights Nursing Home

=========================

To: Greg Parker g_parker@chnh.com
From:Tommy Jenkins tommyjenkins7@zeusnet.com
Date: September 15
Subject: Hiring Procedure

Dear Mr. Parker,

Thank you so much for giving me the opportunity to interview for the position of admissions coordinator. You requested that I inform you about my availability for September 17. I have another interview at 10:00 A.M., but I will be able to be at Colonial Heights Nursing Home by 1:00 P.M. I hope this is convenient for you. Shady Pines Nursing Home, as you know, is a competing facility located on the other side of town, and the hours they offer are very attractive. I would prefer to work in a modern facility such as Colonial Heights.

I look forward to interviewing with you and touring your facilities.

Sincerely,
Tommy Jenkins
What is mentioned about Colonial Heights Nursing Home?
choices: (B)It has operated for over half a century.

answer.explanation:
- Paragraph 1:

"Colonial Heights is proud to have served the elderly population of Houston, Texas, for over 30 years. Our nursing home is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities. Our five-story building allows each floor to offer individualized levels of care for our residents. Our building houses a rehabilitation gym and we also provide psychological counseling services for residents."

question.text: According to the notice, which position does not require experience?

answer.explanation:
- The second paragraph:

"We currently have openings for several positions. We are looking to hire a nursing home administrator who has at least three years of experience and a valid license. There is also an opening for an admissions coordinator. Those applying for the admissions coordinator job must have a bachelor's degree and at least two years of related experience. We are also looking for hospice workers who can provide personal care to residents in a compassionate and caring manner. Previous experience is not necessary, so everyone interested is welcome to apply for this position."

question.text: What is indicated about Colonial Heights Nursing Home?
choices: (A) It plans to expand its facilities.
(B) It accepts applications through its website.
(C) It offers the highest wages in the state.
(D) It recently renewed its operating certificate

answer.text: (B) It accepts applications through its website.
answer.explanation:
- The last line in the notice :

You can see this job listing and submit an application online by visiting our website at www.chnh.com.

question.text: Why might Tommy Jenkins decide not to work for Colonial Heights Nursing Home?
choices: (A) They do not have physical fitness centers.
(C) The job is too far away.
(D) Shady Pines Nursing Home can give him a better schedule.

answer.text: (D) Shady Pines Nursing Home can give him a better schedule.

question.text: When can Tommy Jenkins be at the interview at Colonial Heights?

Long-Awaited Sequel Has Arrived
(June 2) — David Mendoza's eagerly anticipated sequel to the best-selling Waking Up is finally here. The much loved Waking Up chronicled the ups and downs Mendoza experienced as he moved from job to job as a youth, working as everything from dock worker and fisherman, to hotel clerk and tennis
instructor. Life Lessons in Advertising picks up where the previous book left off, with Mendoza having just arrived in New York City. We follow his rise from mailroom clerk to the head of M&D Creative, a highly successful advertising agency.
Written in the humorous, informal style that has made Mendoza's ads so successful over the years, the book shares stories of client case histories and reveals how he developed his most successful advertisements. The book is now available online and in bookstores everywhere.

=================
Book Review: Life Lessons in Advertising
By Julia Turnbull
Given that it took twenty years for David Mendoza d to write his second book, Life Lessons in Advertising, the impression the reader is left with at the end is that he forgot to edit his work. While 1 thoroughly enjoyed Mendoza’s previous book, this sequel is made up of dull, complicated sentences that make reading a chore. There’s no argument regarding his abilities as an advertising executive, yet the anecdotes about life in the advertising business arc so much less engaging than those earlier stories that almost jumped off the pages. For example, nothing matches the earlier book’s crystal clear descriptions of his escapades and unexpected adventures as a hotel clerk in northern Montana. This is one book you can skip.
=================
Advertising in Motion Magazine
A minute with...
Advertising guru David Mendoza

AIMM: Why did it take you so long to write this book?
Mendoza: It's funny. I've always considered my copywriting to be my strength. But long pieces of writing, like manuscripts, are very difficult for me, so 1 take my time to edit them carefully. But I'm very proud of the end result-—it's easy to read and highly enjoyable, just like my first book.
AIMM: You've held so many jobs, like fisherman and tennis instructor. Why do you think advertising stuck?
Mendoza: I'm not so sure it did really stick, although I've been with it for a while. My philosophy is to be open to any opportunity that comes my way. Advertising came my way, but I'm rather sure it's not the last thing I'll try my hand at And you never know, 1 might go back to fishing or tennis.
In the article, the phrase "picks up" in paragraph 2, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "Life Lessons in Advertising picks up where the previous book left off". In this context, "pick up" means "continue after a break".

question.text: What is indicated about Waking Up?
choices: (A)  It was published twenty years ago.
(B)  It has been made into a movie.

answer.text: (A)  It was published twenty years ago.
answer.explanation: The information for this question is in the commentary on the book. Even in the first sentence it is said that the author took 20 years to write the second book. From here it can be deduced that the first book (Walking up) was published 20 years ago.

question.text: In the book review, what is suggested about Mr. Mendoza's time as a hotel clerk?
choices: (D)  He wrote stories in the evenings.

answer.explanation: ‘His escapades and unexpected adventures as a hotel clerk’

question.text: On what point do Mr. Mendoza and Ms. Turnbull disagree?
choices: (A)  Mr. Mendoza's effectiveness as an advertising executive
(B)  Mr. Mendoza's attitude toward reading for pleasure
(C)  The reason Waking Up is popular
(D)  The quality of the writing in Life Lessons in Advertising

answer.text: (D)  The quality of the writing in Life Lessons in Advertising
answer.explanation: As can be seen in the commentary, the Turnbull article says “This sequel made up of dull, complicated sentences that made reading a chore” (this next volume is made up of complicated, stupid sentences that make reading become a tiring job). Meanwhile, Mr. Mendoza said in the interview "I'm proud of the end result." It's easy to read and highly enjoyable ”

question.text: What does Mr. Mendoza imply in the interview transcript?
choices: (A)  He is looking for a new publisher.
(B)  He has recently bought a new fishing boat.
(C)  He learned the most from his job as a tennis instructor.
(D)  He may change his profession again.

answer.text: (D)  He may change his profession again.
answer.explanation: “I am rather sure it’s not the last thing I’ll try my hand at”

question.text:
Midcity Performing Arts Hall

Support the Midcity Performing Arts Hall in downtown Brenton by becoming a member. You can choose from the following membership plans:
General - For only $100, you can get a full-year membership to attend any two performing arts shows that have available seats in the D area of the theater.
Silver - For a fee of $200, you can attend any two performing arts shows that have available seats in the B area of the theater.
Gold - For a fee of $500, you will receive early alerts of popular programs with a ticket to any two performing arts shows with seats in the B area, and a guaranteed seat for any show of your choice within a one-year period in the front row section.
Diamond - For a fee of $1000, you will have exclusive access to signed autographs with performing arts stars, invitations to two exclusive pre-showings of popular programs, and a guaranteed seat for any show of your choice within a one-year period in the VIP section.
*Some restrictions may apply.
*Admissions to orchestral performances excluded

=============================

To:bates@midcityarthall.com
From:Alicia Norton
Date:January 16
Subject:Membership

Thank you for the e-mail about the Midcity Performing Arts Hall membership. I have attached a fee of $1000.1 was a general member last year and I enjoyed a couple of the musicals that were performed. I have become a theater enthusiast since the experience and I look forward to the benefits of the new membership plan.
By the way, the Art Hall has done a phenomenal job on the renovations to the building. I'm excited to come back this year.

===========================

@PS@/kstoeic/images/4448661_1564544782006.png@PE@
Which membership did Alicia Norton most likely purchase?

answer.explanation: In the email, Alica Norton said there was a $ 1000 fee attached. According to the advertisement, this is the diamond membership fee, so this is likely the type of member she bought the most.

question.text: What is meant by the expression “some restrictions may apply”?
choices: (A)Only certain people will be considered for membership.
(B)The membership plans may change without notice.
(C)Not all performances are available to members.

answer.text: (C)Not all performances are available to members.
answer.explanation: "some restrictions may apply", meaning a number of shows will be limited to members. So the most suitable answer is C.

question.text: When is a performance not free to members?

answer.explanation: In the note of the ad, “Admissions to orchestral performances excluded ”, means that members are not allowed to enter free symphonies. The scheduled symphony is scheduled for January.

question.text: What is suggested about the Midcity Performing Arts Hall?
choices: (B)It had some changes made to the building.
(C)It is a place popular among celebrities.

answer.text: (B)It had some changes made to the building.
answer.explanation: Info is located near the bottom of the email "the Art Hall has done a phenomenal job on the renovations to the building"

question.text: What is implied about the schedule?

answer.explanation: As can be seen from the "Tentative schedule" heading, this means that the schedule is changeable.

question.text:
From: Fausto Forletti [11:02 A.M]
To: Steffan Griffiths (029 2018 0743)
Hi. Steffan. I’m with the electrical contractors at the former Millway train station site now. The electrical system was in worse shape than we had originally thought. The rewiring and upgrades are going to cost more than expected because we want to modernize while still retaining the historical integrity of the building.I’ll send over the estimate as soon as I receive it. I’m hoping that all the work will be completed so that we can open as planned in May.
======================================
New Hotel to Open in South Wales
CARDIFF (18 April)—The Millway Road Hotel is scheduled to open on 14 May. The building was once a busy train station that was designed by Arthur Lewison over 150 years ago.
For almost three decades the building had been left unoccupied. It was purchased two years ago by Steffan Griffiths, president of Griffiths Hoteliers.
According to project coordinator Fausto Forletti, the old building required extensive renovation not only to turn it into a hotel but also to update the electrical, heating, and plumbing systems.
The hotel has 25 guest rooms, a meeting room, and a restaurant with banquet facilities. All of Mr. Griffths' facilities are noted for their world-class dining experiences. The hotel’s Bayside Cafe has award-winning Welsh chef Mal Davies to create a menu and oversee the restaurant.
In the near future, Mr. Griffiths plans to expand the property’s garden. For information and reservations, visit www.millwayroadhotel.co.uk.
======================================
✩✩✩✩
Millway Road Hotel
Review posted by Mi-Yeon Ko
I recently attended a small conference at the Millway Road Hotel, which opened in June. As a computer technician, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it had such up-to-date facilities. Both my room and the meeting room had more than enough electrical outlets to plug-in equipment and charge mobile phones and computers. The complimentary wireless internet service was easy to access. On top of that, the food was delicious and the guest rooms were beautiful
Why did Mr. Forletti send the text message?
choices: (A)To explain why a project s cost will increase
(B)To ask for help in solving an electrical problem
(C)To warn that a delivery will be delayed
(D)To discuss a problem with a contractor

answer.text: (A)To explain why a project s cost will increase
answer.explanation:
Line 3 of the message Message: The rewiring and upgrades are going to cost of the building.             

=> The resumption of wire and upgrade will tcin more money than planned because we mucin modernized while retaining the historical integrity of the building.

=> The reason for the increase in costs

=> Key A. To explain why a project's cost will increase.

In a private message, line 1: "at the former train station site Millway now".

=> In the old train station area.

In the article, paragraph 1: The Millway Road Hotel ... busy train station

=> Millway Road Hotel will open on May 14. This building used to be 1 busy train station.

=> Staying on land for a hotel.

=> Key C. At a proposed hotel site

(D)He is the coordinator of a renovation

answer.explanation:
